page.title: 19HAWARDEN CASTLE
page.content: in a room within the wall near the entrance.The castle was surrounded by a curtain wall.After the castle had been started a Welsh prince called David attacked it. It is said "that on Palm Sunday 1282 David's men , went by night to the castle of Hawardyn, burnt and pillaged it. Not long afterwards David was captured and executed.The castle changed hands over the centuries and in 1490 it was in the hands of the Stanley family, it was during their occupation that King Henry V11 visited the castle. From this time until the English Civil War the castle had a fairly peaceful life. However when the English Civil War broke out Hawarden was in an important position as a stronghold of Royalist Chester.The castle also commanded the important routeway to Ireland.In 1643 the castle was captured.
